column4: Got some serious issues with my x configuration, now when I first installed this machine with breezy it worked perfect. Although I dont know what I did to change it. What would be the easist way to go back to the original configuration of x? where it acutally worked? I really dont want to reinstall.?
you can't if you didn't make a backup
you'll have to reconfigure it
back up what you have now and do sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
Yep, definitely didnt back it up, dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg didnt work though.
how didn't it work?
well, I ran that tool, filled in the info it asks for and still no workie :P
sure you filled in the correct info?
can't you get in to X windows at all?
nope
if rerunning sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg doesn't help come back and I'll try to help you out
nope no work
ok. are you using the graphical login?
looking over the logs right now
not right now, got no x at all
but normally?
Yep, normally graphical login
pastebin the most recent file in /var/log/gdm/ as well as /var/log/Xorg.0.log
figuring out how to pastebin these files easily :P
yeah
maybe just paste grep ^EE from those files
